intro: Pityopsis aspera, commonly known as roughleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in a head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Pityopsis aspera is known for its drought tolerance and is often used in native plant landscaping.
